gameDescription: In Operation Pollination, two teams of advanced airships endeavor on eco-rescues across the globe to restore bee populations affected by natural disasters and human activities. Players combine strategic decision-making with environmental conservation, focusing on the crucial role bees play in our ecosystem.

setting.missionStart: Apis Aviators and Bombus Navigators Headquarters

blueTeam.name: Apis Aviators
blueTeam.description: Experts in eco-recovery and bee habilitation.

redTeam.name: Bombus Navigators
redTeam.description: Specialists in habitat restoration and community engagement.

turns.scenario: A hurricane has severely damaged a major bee habitat. Players need to implement effective strategies for post-disaster recovery.

options.A: Plant native flowers in hurricane-affected areas to restore bee habitats.
options.B: Establish new bee colonies in safe zones post-disaster.

AA.narrative: Both teams work together to rejuvenate the floral landscape. The bees soon return to a festival of pollen as the natural balance begins to restore.

AB.narrative: While one team plants flowers, the other establishes new colonies. They complement each other perfectly to stimulate a rapid recovery.

BA.narrative: As one team moves bees to safety, the other fosters new habitats. Their joint effort sees the bee population rebound more quickly than projected.

BB.narrative: Both teams prioritise bee safety. The new colonies flutter with life, boding well for the future of these resilient pollinators.

turns.scenario: A recent wildfire presents an urgent task of restoration. Players must choose strategies that will support displaced bee populations.

options.A: Seed fire-ravaged areas with bee-friendly vegetation.
options.B: Create artificial bee habitats in unaffected regions.

AA.narrative: Both teams opt to sow new life into the scorched earth. An explosion of green soon covers the brown, providing forage for a multitude of bee species.

AB.narrative: One team plants seeds as the other creates safe havens. Together, they oversee the resurgence of a thriving bee community.

BA.narrative: With one team building refuges and the other planting vegetation, the fire-ravaged region soon buzzes with renewed vigour.

BB.narrative: Both teams focus on infrastructure, creating plentiful sanctuary spaces. Their efforts provide an immediate haven for the displaced bees.

turns.scenario: To promote long-term conservation, players must devise sustainable strategies to grow and protect bee populations.

options.A: Develop bee sanctuaries with advanced ecological technology.
options.B: Engage in educational campaigns to increase bee conservation awareness.

AA.narrative: Both teams create state-of-the-art sanctuaries. This move amplifies their conservation efforts, providing a safe environment for the bees to prosper.

AB.narrative: As one team develops sanctuaries, the other enlightens the public. This balace of science and community outreach makes a profound difference in preserving bee populations.

BA.narrative: One team focuses on education while the other builds sanctuaries. Their synergy enables more impactful conservation, leading to healthier bee populations.

BB.narrative: Both teams embark on a massive awareness campaign. They impart the importance of bees to ecosystems, sparking a wave of community-led conservation initiatives.
